column4: If my video card was working with the other kernel and all I did was an apt-get upgrade and got the new one it should still work correct?
nvidia?
no problem
the new kernel works with the linux-restricted-modules
what version of kernel and l-r-m do you have?
you're using Warty?
what version of linux-restricted-modules do you have?
it needs to match your kernel version exactly
it needs to match your kernel version exactly.  That's the proble.
updating now
That worked
no problem :)
I have a dumb question. What does l-r-m do?
it contains "restricted" modules like nvidia and fglrx
Maybe it is just not me understanding how Debian and Ubuntu does things but why didnt installing the nvidia kernel give me the module?
you installed nvidia-glx, not a kernel module
the module itself is in l-r-m
I really have nvidia-kernel-common installed
No big deal I was just wondering
yes, I know
but that contains other files
Just was a little confusing
dpkg -L nvidia-kernel-common
it doesn't contain anything in /lib/modules
